item.title: Deborah add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "In the depth of winter, I finally learned that within me there lay an invincible summer." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Deborah add a quote by Douglas Bader
item.description: "Rules are for the obedience of fools and the guidance of wise men." -- Douglas Bader

item.title: Deborah add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "For most of history, Anonymous was a woman." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Deborah add a quote by George Carlin
item.description: "Meow” means “woof” in cat." -- George Carlin

item.title: Deborah add a quote by George Carlin
item.description: "Those who dance are considered insane by those who cannot hear the music." -- George Carlin

item.title: Deborah add a quote by Alice Hoffman
item.description: "Books may well be the only true magic." -- Alice Hoffman

item.title: Deborah add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "The individual has always had to struggle to keep from being overwhelmed by the tribe. If you try it, you will be lonely often, and sometimes frightened. But no price is too high to pay for the privilege of owning yourself." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Deborah add a quote by George Carlin
item.description: "Some people see things that are and ask, Why? Some people dream of things that never were and ask, Why not? Some people have to go to work and don't have time for all that." -- George Carlin

item.title: Deborah add a quote by George Carlin
item.description: "Men are from Earth, women are from Earth. Deal with it." -- George Carlin

item.title: Deborah add a quote by Robert H. Schuller
item.description: "The only place where your dream becomes impossible is in your own thinking." -- Robert H. Schuller

item.title: Deborah add a quote by Isaac Asimov
item.description: "The saddest aspect of life right now is that science gathers knowledge faster than society gathers wisdom." -- Isaac Asimov

item.title: Deborah add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Almost always the creative, dedicated minority has made the world better. " -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Deborah add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "Anything you dream is fiction, and anything you accomplish is science, the whole history of mankind is nothing but science fiction. " -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Deborah add a quote by L. Ron Hubbard
item.description: "Happiness and strength endure only in the absence of hate. To hate alone is the road to disaster. To love is the road to strength. To love in spite of all is the secret of greatness. And may very well be the greatest secret in this universe." -- L. Ron Hubbard

item.title: Deborah add a quote by Isaac Asimov
item.description: "If my doctor told me I had only six minutes to live, I wouldn't brood. I'd type a little faster." -- Isaac Asimov

item.title: Deborah add a quote by Isaac Asimov
item.description: "And above all things, never think that you’re not good enough yourself. A man should never think that. My belief is that in life people will take you at your own reckoning. " -- Isaac Asimov

item.title: Deborah add a quote by Agatha Christie
item.description: "One doesn't recognize the really important moments in one's life until it's too late." -- Agatha Christie

item.title: Deborah add a quote by Agatha Christie
item.description: "An archaeologist is the best husband a woman can have. The older she gets, the more interested he is in her." -- Agatha Christie

item.title: Deborah add a quote by Lawrence Sanders
item.description: "One never knows, do one?" -- Lawrence Sanders

item.title: Deborah add a quote by Dennis Wheatley
item.description: "...age-old evil, tireless and vigilant, cloaked from the masses by modern skepticism, yet still a potent force stalking the dark ways of the night." -- Dennis Wheatley

item.title: Deborah add a quote by Booker T. Washington
item.description: "I will permit no man to narrow and degrade my soul by making me hate him." -- Booker T. Washington

item.title: Deborah add a quote by Eric Hoffer
item.description: "Passionate hatreds can give meaning and purpose to an empty life. These people haunted by the purposelessness of their lives try to find a new content not only by dedicating themselves to a holy cause but also by nursing a fanatical grievance." -- Eric Hoffer

item.title: Deborah add a quote by E. Stanley Jones
item.description: "A Rattlesnake, if Cornered will become so angry it will bite itself. That is exactly what the harboring of hate and resentment against others is - a biting of oneself. We think we are harming others in holding these spites and hates, but the deeper harm is to ourselves." -- E. Stanley Jones

item.title: Deborah add a quote by Madrianne Arvore
item.description: "Hate cages all the good things about you. " -- Madrianne Arvore

item.title: Deborah add a quote by Eldridge Cleaver
item.description: "The price of hating other human beings is loving oneself less." -- Eldridge Cleaver

item.title: Deborah add a quote by Tacitus
item.description: "It is a principle of nature to hate those whom you have injured." -- Tacitus

item.title: Deborah add a quote by Honore de Balzac
item.description: "Hatred is the vice of narrow souls; they feed it with all their littleness, and make it the pretext of base tyrannies." -- Honore de Balzac

item.title: Deborah add a quote by Jean de LaBruyere
item.description:
"A mediocre mind thinks it writes divinely; a good mind thinks it writes reasonably.
" -- Jean de LaBruyere

item.title: Deborah add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You must stay drunk on writing so reality cannot destroy you." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Deborah add a quote by Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
item.description: "Every heart has its secret sorrows which the world knows not, and oftentimes we call a man cold, when he is only sad." -- Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
